intro: Horkelia tridentata, commonly known as the three-lobed horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and open woodlands. It has small, ovate leaves that are often gland-dotted, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Horkelia tridentata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with limited rainfall.
